explanation: The condition in the second loop relied on implicit truthiness (S[i] % 25) and a potentially unclear use of 'not' with chained comparisons. This can be ambiguous and error-prone. I made the check explicit: test divisibility with 'S[i] % 25 != 0' and parenthesized the range test 'not (100 <= S[i] <= 675)'. This preserves the original intent (reject values that are not multiples of 25 or outside the range) while avoiding precedence/clarity issues.
